definition: not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve

sentences.english: The drinkers also seem more blase than ever about the consequences.
sentences.chinese: 而他們似乎對後果也更加地漠不關心。

sentences.english: Operating in a vacuum of disinterest has done nothing to grow the sport.
sentences.chinese: 漠不關心的態度對這項運動的發展沒有任何好處。

sentences.english: We should be warm towards our comrades, not ice cold and indifferent.
sentences.chinese: 看待同志要滿腔熱忱，不能冷冷清清，漠不關心。

sentences.english: Does not everything begin with indifference?
sentences.chinese: 開始時不也總是漠不關心的嗎？

sentences.english: Some operators don't give a damn.
sentences.chinese: 一些運營者對此漠不關心。
他聳聳肩，漠不關心的樣子。

sentences.english: Apart from his study, he is indifferent to everything because he comes from a defunct family.
sentences.chinese: 除此以外，他對所有無關於己的事情漠不關心。

sentences.english: PIERRE BOULEZ. Is there really only lack of attention, indifference on the part of the listener toward contemporary music?
sentences.chinese: 聽衆對當代音樂真的缺乏注意和漠不關心嗎？

sentences.english: Many people keep aloof from politics.
sentences.chinese: 許多人對政治漠不關心。

sentences.english: He was as indifferent to his powers as they were prolific.
sentences.chinese: 他對於他那多產的創作力漠不關心。

sentences.english: Indifference to these problems will mean committing suicide.
sentences.chinese: 對這些問題漠不關心將意味着自我毀滅。

sentences.english: One of his assistants was careless about a culture of chicken cholera germs.
sentences.chinese: 他的一位助手對一組雞霍亂培養菌漠不關心。

sentences.english: On can always be kind to people one cares nothing about.
sentences.chinese: 對於哪些偶們漠不關心地人，偶們總能做到溫文爾雅。

sentences.english: I wasn’t going to let him off so lightly.
sentences.chinese: 我不能這樣漠不關心地讓他離去。

sentences.english: Have we been greedy, ignorant, uncaring?
sentences.chinese: 難道我們一直很貪婪，無知，漠不關心？

definition: to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
